result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amber L. Roehl

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:32 PM/ RM 203, 22CF179 & 22CF47. Defendant Amber L. Roehl appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Julianne M Lennon in court for Amber L. Roehl.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Court reviews case history's. Court questions if Def. would like to appear in person or if zoom appearance is satisfactory. Def. is okay to proceed via zoom appearance. Court accepts Def. appearance via zoom. State is prepared to proceed with P.H. State requests transactional relationship. Court reviews criminal complaint. Atty Lennon has no objection. Court accepts transactional relationship. State calls first witness, Deputy Travis Krueger. Deputy Krueger sworn in under oath and testifies. Atty Lennon questions Deputy Krueger. State rests. State requests Court take judicial notice of Marathon case no. 20CF396. Court questions State regarding relevance, State responds. Court reviews judgment of conviction on 20CF396 dated 12/29/21. Atty Lennon has no objection. Court takes judicial notice of Marathon case no. 20CF396 for today's purposes. State gives argument and requests Court to bind over. Atty Lennon gives argument. Court has reviewed criminal complaint, finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings. State requests arraignment on a later date. Atty Lennon requests to appear via zoom for arraignment. Court approves. State requests 20CF47 track along.
Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Court calls @ 2:10 PM/ RM 301, 22CF179 & 22CF47. Defendant Amber L. Roehl in court, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Julianne M Lennon in court for Amber L. Roehl.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Court wishes to acknowledge 22CF179 first, scheduled for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.  Atty. Lennon acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading, preserves jurisdictional objections, enters plea of Not Guilty on Misdemeanors and requests P.H. on Felonies. Atty Lennon questions bond hearing. Court questions bond amount. Atty Lennon responds, bond was previously set at $4,000.00 cash in 22CF179. Court questions conditions. State makes remarks regarding conditions. $1,000.00 signature bond has been set in 22CF47. Atty Lennon requests timely preliminary hearing. Court questions if State is okay going along with bond hearing today, State confirms. Atty Lennon gives bail bond argument and requests $500.00 cash bond in 22CF179. Court reviews criminal complaint. State objects to modification of bond and gives reasoning. State notes Def. pending cases in Shawano, Marathon and Langlade Counties. Atty Lennon makes remarks regarding Def. previous non appearance in Shawano County case and gives bail bond argument. Def. father in court and can post $500.00 bond for Def. today. Court has concerns and denies bond modification. Court allows Def. right to renew request on a timely P.H. Atty Lennon responds and notes her next appearance in Langlade County. Court goes off record. Court goes back on record, 2:27 PM. Timely P.H. will be held on October 11th, 1:30 PM in front of CC Kawalski. Court notes Not Guilty pleas entered by Atty Lennon on 22CF179 will be noted until information is filed. 22CF47, State is ready to proceed with P.H. Chief Daniel Duley sworn in under oath and testifies. State requests Court take judicial notice of Shawano Co. case 19CF322. Atty Lennon does not wish to make any record at this time. Court takes judicial notice of case no. 19CF322 from Shawano Co. Atty Lennon questions Chief Duley. State rests. Defense does not have any further witnesses. Atty Lennon is not contesting bind over. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further proceedings, to include filing of information. State files information in court electronically. State notes Ct. 3 is missing repeater enhancer and adds to information. Atty Lennon waives reading, reserves rights and enters Not Guilty plea on 22CF47. Court accepts Not Guilty plea. 22CF47 to track along with 22CF179.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(Confirmed with JA on 10/6/22, 10/11 hearing will be in front of CC DeBord)

Adjustment Number: 22A 035601,
Payable Number: 67200,
Receipt Number: 22R 003953,
Amount: $20.00

1:45 PM Defendant Amber L. Roehl appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Atty Julianne Lennon special appearance in person for Amber Roehl. Atty Lennon requests AIA for October 5th with other case court date. Atty Lennon requests bail modification. Court denies, cannot modify.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Routed to Judge's JA

for bail bond modification

ADDRESS INFO for Amber L. Roehl
Current: 1208 Clermont St., Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 1810 Fairmount Street, Wausau, WI 54403

No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. 
No contact with codefendants Tony Rootes and Kevin Alloway.

1:58 PM Defendant Amber L. Roehl appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. State notes Def. has been released on multiple prior bonds and has lengthy record in Shawano and Marathon Counties. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with codefendants Tony Rootes and Kevin Alloway. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court considers bail bond factors. Def. Father in courtroom and makes remarks. Court orders $4,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with codefendants Tony Rootes and Kevin Alloway.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
